description: Demoliton of bungalow, garage, greenhouse and front boundary wall and erection of a terrace of six 3-storey, 3-bedroom dwellinghouses with basements, front lightwells and rear lower and upper ground terraces, provision of two car parking spaces with new vehicular and pedestrian accesses, footpath across site frontage and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans ref: 5.4 Proposed Basement Floor Plan, 5.5 Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 5.6 Proposed First Floor Plan, 5.7 Proposed Loft Floor Plan, 5.8 Proposed Roof Plan, 5.9 Proposed Rear Elevation, 5.10 Proposed Front Elevation, 5.11 Proposed End Elevation (East Facing), 5.12 Proposed End Elevation (West Facing), 5.13 Proposed Section A-A, 5.14 Proposed Section B-B, 5.15 Proposed Section overlay of the Exisitng & Proposed building envelope received 24/09/2008, details (samples/detailed drawings/manufacturers specification information) of materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority  .Reason: To ensure that the development achieves a quality external appearance and is environmentally sound and compatible with the surrounding development and Mount Park and Haven Green Conservation Areas, in accordance with policies 2.1, 4.1 and 4.8 of the Council's adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans ref: 5.9 Proposed Rear Elevation, 5.10 Proposed Front Elevation, 5.11, Proposed End Elevation (East Facing), 5.12 Proposed End Elevation (West Facing), 5.13 Proposed Section A-A, 5.14 Proposed Section B-B, 5.15 Proposed Section overlay of the Existing & Proposed building envelope received 24/09/2008, details of the positions, design, materials to include type of boundary treatment to be erected shall be submitted to and improved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The boundary treatment shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers and Mount Park and Haven Green Conservation Areas in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8  and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking space shown on the approved plan ref: 5.2 Proposed Site Plan rev B  received on 09/01/09 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this space shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). |    Notwithstanding the provisions of Part 1 Classes A to F, and Part 2 Classes A and B of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008, no extensions walls/fences, buildings within the curtilage, oil tanks, satellite antenna or other alterations, means of enclosure or the formation, laying out and construction of a means of access to a highway shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). |    Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted for approval to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and for the remedial works to be implemented before any other works commence.     Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). |    Details of sound attenuation measures from traffic and aircraft noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential unit shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential unit and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 - Noise and Vibration. |    The development shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). |    The refuse and recycling storage as detailed on the submitted plans ref: 5.2 Proposed Site Plan rev B  received on 09/01/09 shall be constructed on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and shall thereafter be retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority  .Reason:  To ensure suitable loading, unloading and refuse collection arrangements are provided in order to ensure pedestrian and highway safety and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 9.1 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Details of the scheme for the disposal of surface water and sewage shall be submitted and approved in writing and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be in place and fully operational, prior to the occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure the proposed drainage of the development is in accordance with the required standards and that the development does not pollute the water environment, or give rise to an increase risk of flooding, nor to an overloading of the sewage system in the locality, in accordance with policies 2.1 & 4.1.the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). |    The development hereby authorised shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design.'Reason: In the interests of crime prevention and the safety and security of users of the site, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 (Safer Ealing). | Prior to the commencement of the development a `Construction Strategy` shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The means of site management and construction shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Strategy, which should also include details of the means of access for construction works and details of noise, vibration and dust mitigation measures during the redevelopment.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
